predictions.text: The European Central Bank will leave the deposit facility rate unchanged at its December 2025 policy meeting.
predictions.verification_criteria: ECB’s official monetary policy press release on ecb.europa.eu for the December 2025 meeting shows no change to the deposit facility rate from its prior level.
evidence: Disinflation narrative has strengthened into year-end, lowering urgency for further tightening.
Market pricing historically shows limited December policy changes absent shocks.
monitoring_signals: Euro area HICP headline and core prints versus expectations
ECB speakers’ guidance ahead of the meeting
PMIs and credit conditions survey trends
predictions.rationale: Cooling inflation and cautious ECB communication point to a hold into year-end.

predictions.text: U.S. Average Hourly Earnings (Total Private, MoM, SA) for November 2025 will print between +0.2% and +0.4%.
predictions.verification_criteria: BLS Employment Situation report for November 2025 shows Average Hourly Earnings, Total Private, seasonally adjusted MoM change within +0.2% to +0.4%.
evidence: ADP: November private payrolls fell 32,000, signaling cooling labor demand. https://www.cnbc.com/2025/12/03/adp-jobs-report-november-2025-private-payrolls-unexpectedly-fell-by-32000-.html

Stocks embraced weak hiring as disinflationary, aligning with moderate wage growth. https://www.marketwatch.com/story/stock-market-closes-on-doorstep-of-record-territory-as-investors-focus-on-bright-side-of-weak-private-sector-hiring-d541fd19
monitoring_signals: Indeed Wage Tracker and job postings
predictions.rationale: Cooling labor demand and easing inflation pressures favor moderate wage gains.

predictions.text: ISM Manufacturing PMI (headline, U.S.) for November 2025 will print between 47.5 and 49.5.
predictions.verification_criteria: Institute for Supply Management’s official November 2025 Manufacturing PMI headline value is within 47.5–49.5.
evidence: Manufacturing remained sluggish through 2025 as goods demand normalized post-pandemic.
Soft labor data (ADP) suggest ongoing cooling momentum.
monitoring_signals: Regional Fed manufacturing surveys (Empire, Philly, Richmond)
Chicago PMI and S&P Global Manufacturing PMI
predictions.rationale: Regional surveys imply continued contraction but not severe deterioration.

predictions.text: University of Michigan Consumer Sentiment Index (preliminary) for December 2025 will print between 72.0 and 79.0.
predictions.verification_criteria: University of Michigan preliminary December 2025 headline index value is between 72.0 and 79.0 per official release.
evidence: Stocks closed near records as rate expectations eased. https://www.marketwatch.com/story/stock-market-closes-on-doorstep-of-record-territory-as-investors-focus-on-bright-side-of-weak-private-sector-hiring-d541fd19
Weaker hiring can buoy real income sentiment if inflation cools.
monitoring_signals: Job market perceptions in high-frequency surveys
predictions.rationale: Easier financial conditions support sentiment, offset by mixed job signals.

predictions.text: Apple will publish at least one December 2025 security update acknowledging a vulnerability that 'may have been actively exploited.'
predictions.verification_criteria: Apple’s security updates page for December 2025 contains language indicating an actively exploited vulnerability (e.g., 'Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been actively exploited').
evidence: Apple regularly discloses actively exploited 0-days across iOS/macOS.
Heightened late-year vulnerability disclosures across vendors.
Apple Security Updates portal: https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT201222
monitoring_signals: CISA KEV catalog additions referencing Apple CVEs
Threat intel reports (Citizen Lab, Project Zero)
Exploit broker activity and iOS/macOS zero-day chatter
predictions.rationale: Apple frequently patches year-round; Q4 often sees at least one exploited 0‑day disclosed.

predictions.text: The EU will announce at least one new Russia-related sanctions designation by 2025-12-31 via an official Council press release or the Official Journal.
predictions.verification_criteria: Publication of a Council of the EU press release or Official Journal entry in December 2025 that adds at least one Russia-related designation.
evidence: EU racing to secure Ukraine financing tied to Russian assets. https://www.cnbc.com/2025/12/03/russia-ready-for-war-with-europe-putin-says-before-ukraine-peace-talks.html
Regular EU sanctions maintenance cycles into year-end.
monitoring_signals: Draft OJ listings circulating in Brussels press
predictions.rationale: Ongoing Russia-Ukraine dynamics and EU financing needs sustain incremental sanctions actions.

predictions.text: BTC/USD spot will trade at or below $60,000 on at least one UTC day by 2025-12-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Any reputable consolidated spot source (e.g., Coinbase/CoinDesk daily low on a UTC calendar day) shows BTC/USD ≤ $60,000.
evidence: Bitcoin has lagged lofty predictions; volatility persists. https://www.nytimes.com/2025/12/03/technology/cryptocurrencies-tumble-trump-rally.html
Macro event risk (FOMC, CPI) can trigger downside swings.
monitoring_signals: On-chain realized volatility and whale flows
predictions.rationale: Year-end macro events and fragile risk appetite leave downside tails open.

predictions.text: Cboe VIX will close at or above 18.0 on at least one trading day by 2025-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Cboe’s official VIX historical data shows a daily close ≥ 18.0 on any trading day through 2025-12-31.
evidence: Low-volatility regimes can be punctuated by sharp event-driven spikes.
December features dense macro/policy catalysts (CPI, FOMC).
predictions.rationale: Even calm markets often see at least one volatility flare into year-end.

predictions.text: Seasonally adjusted U.S. Initial Jobless Claims for the week ending 2025-11-29 will print between 220,000 and 245,000.
predictions.verification_criteria: U.S. Department of Labor Weekly Claims news release dated 2025-12-05 shows initial claims (seasonally adjusted) for the week ended 2025-11-29 within 220k–245k.
evidence: ADP shows weakening labor demand. https://www.cnbc.com/2025/12/03/adp-jobs-report-november-2025-private-payrolls-unexpectedly-fell-by-32000-.html
Thanksgiving weeks often introduce mild volatility but within common ranges.
monitoring_signals: Online job postings and layoff trackers
predictions.rationale: Softening labor demand with typical seasonal noise should keep claims in a moderate band.

predictions.text: U.S. PCE Price Index (headline, MoM, SA) for November 2025 will print between +0.0% and +0.2%.
predictions.verification_criteria: BEA’s Personal Income and Outlays report for November 2025 shows headline PCE MoM within +0.0% to +0.2%.
evidence: Markets are embracing disinflation signals into year-end. https://www.marketwatch.com/story/stock-market-closes-on-doorstep-of-record-territory-as-investors-focus-on-bright-side-of-weak-private-sector-hiring-d541fd19
Cooling goods prices and stable services moderation.
monitoring_signals: CPI/PPI details for November (weights to PCE)
predictions.rationale: Disinflation trend and energy softness point to a low monthly PCE print.

predictions.text: The Bank of Canada will leave its policy rate unchanged at its December 2025 decision.
predictions.verification_criteria: BoC’s December 2025 rate statement posted on bankofcanada.ca shows no change in the target overnight rate from its prior setting.
evidence: Recent Canadian growth has been soft, reducing urgency for hikes.
Inflation progress has been uneven but generally easing into year-end.
monitoring_signals: GDP/monthly output and labor market prints
predictions.rationale: Soft growth and ongoing disinflation argue for a policy pause.

predictions.text: ICE Endex TTF front-month natural gas will settle at or below €35.00/MWh on at least one trading day by 2025-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: ICE Endex official settlement prices for TTF front-month show a settlement ≤ €35.00/MWh on any trading day through 2025-12-31.
evidence: EU gas storage remains seasonally high entering winter.
LNG supply and mild weather scenarios cap price spikes.
monitoring_signals: LNG cargo arrivals and pipeline flows
predictions.rationale: Comfortable storage and LNG supply increase odds of a sub-€35 print.

predictions.text: The U.S. 5-Year Treasury yield (FRED: DGS5) will close at or below 3.95% on at least one trading day by 2025-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: FRED series DGS5 daily close at or below 3.95% on any trading day through 2025-12-31.
evidence: Weak labor data and disinflation expectations can pull intermediate yields lower.
Event risk (CPI, FOMC) may induce duration rallies.
predictions.rationale: A soft data surprise into year-end could briefly push the 5y below 4%.
